trans-unit.source: Important: If you want your virtual machine to use a virtual network, make sure you specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Important: If you want your virtual machine to use a virtual network, make sure you specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine can be configured to join a virtual network only when you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine can be configured to join a virtual network only when you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about virtual networks, see <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about virtual networks, see <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Login to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[azurepreviewportal]</linkText><title></title></link> using your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Login to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[azurepreviewportal]</linkText><title></title></link> using your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +New, click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +New, click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a New Virtual Machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a New Virtual Machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under the SUSE group, select an OpenSUSE virtual machine image, and then click the forward arrow at the bottom right of the page.
trans-unit.target: Under the SUSE group, select an OpenSUSE virtual machine image, and then click the forward arrow at the bottom right of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the first Virtual machine configuration page, fill in or verify the settings:
trans-unit.target: On the first Virtual machine configuration page, fill in or verify the settings:

trans-unit.source: Type a Virtual Machine Name, such as "testlinuxvm".
trans-unit.target: Type a Virtual Machine Name, such as "testlinuxvm".

trans-unit.source: Verify the Tier and pick a Size.
trans-unit.target: Verify the Tier and pick a Size.

trans-unit.source: The tier determines the sizes you can choose from.
trans-unit.target: The tier determines the sizes you can choose from.

trans-unit.source: Type a New User Name, such as "newuser", which will be added to the Sudoers list file.
trans-unit.target: Type a New User Name, such as "newuser", which will be added to the Sudoers list file.

trans-unit.source: Decide which type of Authentication to use.
trans-unit.target: Decide which type of Authentication to use.

trans-unit.source: For general password guidelines, see <link><linkText>Strong passwords</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For general password guidelines, see <link><linkText>Strong passwords</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the next Virtual machine configuration page, fill in or verify the settings:
trans-unit.target: On the next Virtual machine configuration page, fill in or verify the settings:

trans-unit.source: Use the default Create a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Use the default Create a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: In the DNS Name box, type a valid DNS name to use as part of the address, such as "testlinuxvm".
trans-unit.target: In the DNS Name box, type a valid DNS name to use as part of the address, such as "testlinuxvm".

trans-unit.source: In the Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: In the Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow to finish, then wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine and then starts it.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow to finish, then wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine and then starts it.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: You'll use SSH or PuTTY to connect to the virtual machine, depending on the operating system you're running on your computer:
trans-unit.target: You'll use SSH or PuTTY to connect to the virtual machine, depending on the operating system you're running on your computer:

trans-unit.source: If you're using Linux to connect to the VM, use SSH.
trans-unit.target: If you're using Linux to connect to the VM, use SSH.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, run:
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, run:

trans-unit.source: $ ssh newuser@testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net -o ServerAliveInterval=180
trans-unit.target: $ ssh newuser@testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net -o ServerAliveInterval=180

trans-unit.source: Type the user's password.
trans-unit.target: Type the user's password.

trans-unit.source: If you're using Windows computer to connect to the VM, use PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: If you're using Windows computer to connect to the VM, use PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: You can PuTTY download from the <link><linkText>PuTTY Download Page[puttydownload]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can PuTTY download from the <link><linkText>PuTTY Download Page[puttydownload]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Download and save putty.exe to a directory on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Download and save putty.exe to a directory on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt, navigate to that folder, and execute putty.exe.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt, navigate to that folder, and execute putty.exe.

trans-unit.source: Type the host name, such as "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net", and type "22" for the Port.
trans-unit.target: Type the host name, such as "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net", and type "22" for the Port.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PuTTY Screen</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PuTTY Screen</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Update the Virtual Machine (optional)
trans-unit.target: Update the Virtual Machine (optional)

trans-unit.source: After you've connected to the virtual machine, you can optionally install system updates and patches.
trans-unit.target: After you've connected to the virtual machine, you can optionally install system updates and patches.

trans-unit.source: To run the update, type:
trans-unit.target: To run the update, type:

trans-unit.source: $ sudo zypper update
trans-unit.target: $ sudo zypper update

trans-unit.source: Select Software, then Online Update to list available updates.
trans-unit.target: Select Software, then Online Update to list available updates.

trans-unit.source: Select Accept to start the installation and apply all new available patches (except the optional ones).
trans-unit.target: Select Accept to start the installation and apply all new available patches (except the optional ones).

trans-unit.source: After installation is done, select Finish.
trans-unit.target: After installation is done, select Finish.

trans-unit.source: Your system is now up to date.
trans-unit.target: Your system is now up to date.
